ul.li: Implementation Guide Version: 4.0.1
FHIR Version: 4.0.1
Supported Formats: application/fhir+xml, xml, application/fhir+json, json, application/x-turtle, ttl, html/json, html/xml, html/turtle
Supported Patch Formats:
Published by: Den telemedicinske infrastruktur (eHealth Infrastructure)

blockquote.p: Any FHIR capability may be 'allowed' by the system unless explicitly marked as 'SHALL NOT'. A few items are marked as MAY in the Implementation Guide to highlight their potential relevance to the use case.

div.p: The summary table lists the resources that are part of this configuration, and for each resource it lists:

ul.li: The relevant profiles (if any)

The interactions supported by each resource (Read, Search, Update, and Create, are always shown, while VRead, Patch, Delete, History on Instance, or History on Type are only present if at least one of the resources has support for them.

li.span: The required, recommended, and some optional search parameters (if any).

ul.li: The linked resources enabled for _include
The other resources enabled for _revinclude
The operations on the resource (if any)

b.title: GET past versions of resources (vread interaction)
GET all set of resources of the type (search interaction)
PUT a new resource version (update interaction)

ul.li: resourceId: reference to the ActivityDefinition resource that should be cloned
clone_operation: minor-version/major-version/copy Coding from codesystem: http://ehealth.sundhed.dk/cs/ehealth-clone-operation
default-clone-behavior: true/false. False signifies deep-clone mode where the list of deep-clone-references determine which resources should be cloned
deep-clone-references: References to resources to create as new resources rather than referencing the existing ones.

div.p: Bundle containing all resources that were created during the operation.

ul.li: New business versions require that the user has modifier-role: owner or co-author for the resource
New copy does not require that the user has a modifier-role.
New business version can be made only when no draft resource exists (having identical base identifier).
Read/search/create privileges are required for the resource types affected by $create-clone
Supports update, search-type, vread, read, create.

ul.li: planDefinitionPackage: Binary package produced by the export operation

div.p: Bundle containing the created resources. PlanDefinitions, ActivityDefinitions, and Questionnaires will be created. Imports QFFD DocumentReference into Document-Transformation service.Libraries and Organizations are used to find the corresponding resources on the target system.
Export a PlanDefinition.
The export contains the PlanDefinition including referenced resources:- PlanDefinitions

ul.li: ActivityDefinitions
Questionnaires
Libraries
Organizations
DocumentReference + QFDD

div.p: Each resource is returned in a separate JSon file.

ul.li: exclude: references to ActivityDefinitions or PlanDefinitions to exclude from the export.

div.p: Output can be found in Binary.content. This is a Base64 encoded .zip file containing JSon files. All returned objects are Fhir resources. See the implementation guide for details

ul.li: resourceId: reference to the PlanDefinition resource that should be cloned
clone_operation: minor-version/major-version/copy Coding from codesystem: http://ehealth.sundhed.dk/cs/ehealth-clone-operation
default-clone-behavior: true/false. False signifies deep-clone mode where the list of deep-clone-references determine which resources should be cloned
deep-clone-references: References to resources to create as new resources rather than referencing the existing ones.

div.p: Bundle containing all resources that were created during the operation.

ul.li: New business versions require that the user has modifier-role: owner or co-author for the resource
New copy does not require that the user has a modifier-role.
New business version can be made only when no draft resource exists (having identical base identifier).
Read/search/create privileges are required for the resource types affected by $create-clone

div.p: Create a careplan for a specific episodeOfCare using this PlanDefinition as a template.

### Input - resourceId: reference to the ActivityDefinition resource that should be cloned - clone_operation: minor-version/major-version/copy Coding from codesystem: http://ehealth.sundhed.dk/cs/ehealth-clone-operation - default-clone-behavior: true/false. False signifies deep-clone mode where the list of deep-clone-references determine which resources should be cloned - deep-clone-references: References to resources to create as new resources rather than referencing the existing ones.
### Output Bundle containing all resources that were created during the operation.
### Validation - New business versions require that the user has modifier-role: owner or co-author for the resource - New copy does not require that the user has a modifier-role. - New business version can be made only when no draft resource exists (having identical base identifier). - Read/search/create privileges are required for the resource types affected by $create-clone

Import a Plandefinition ### Parameters - planDefinitionPackage: Binary package produced by the export operation ### Output Bundle containing the created resources. PlanDefinitions, ActivityDefinitions, and Questionnaires will be created. Imports QFFD DocumentReference into Document-Transformation service.Libraries and Organizations are used to find the corresponding resources on the target system.

Export a PlanDefinition. ### Export Contents The export contains the PlanDefinition including referenced resources:- PlanDefinitions - ActivityDefinitions - Questionnaires - Libraries - Organizations - DocumentReference + QFDD
Each resource is returned in a separate JSon file. ### Parameters - exclude: references to ActivityDefinitions or PlanDefinitions to exclude from the export. ### Output Output can be found in Binary.content. This is a Base64 encoded .zip file containing JSon files. All returned objects are Fhir resources. See the implementation guide for details

### Input - resourceId: reference to the PlanDefinition resource that should be cloned - clone_operation: minor-version/major-version/copy Coding from codesystem: http://ehealth.sundhed.dk/cs/ehealth-clone-operation - default-clone-behavior: true/false. False signifies deep-clone mode where the list of deep-clone-references determine which resources should be cloned - deep-clone-references: References to resources to create as new resources rather than referencing the existing ones.
### Output Bundle containing all resources that were created during the operation.
### Validation - New business versions require that the user has modifier-role: owner or co-author for the resource - New copy does not require that the user has a modifier-role. - New business version can be made only when no draft resource exists (having identical base identifier). - Read/search/create privileges are required for the resource types affected by $create-clone
Create a careplan for a specific episodeOfCare using this PlanDefinition as a template.
Data migration
Provides the number of resources currently stored on the server, broken down by resource type
